intro: Wormskioldia pilosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wormskioldia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and drought tolerance.
